ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Through this course, I was able to learn more about the grammatical rules of Arabic and apply them to my writing and speaking skills.

I learned a much greater depth and insight into the grammar of the language. 
I additionally learned a lot of culture specific to the Middle East. 
I thoroughly enjoyed learning different colloquialisms as well.
Learned a ton of Arabic. More vocabulary. More grammatical constructions. Better speaking and listening skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the strengths are the emphasis on speaking and grammar, but I think a better job could've been job in encouraging grammar. I think our class in particular had different ranges of speaking ability so it was difficult to speak on the same level as peers who had already studied abroad in the past. I also think that the Lingco assignments were helpful in some cases but in other cases would be tedious and took up a lot of time and did not necessarily correspond to the lesson in class. I wish we had other HW assignments that encouraged practice in concepts during class rather than Lingco. I also think that the asynchronous assignments were fun and encouraged speaking with peers but I wish it aligned more with what we are learning.

Strengths: 
Professor's preparedness and organization and passion
TFs comments 
Group Friday Asynchronous

Weaknesses:
Lack of overall clarity in the instruction of assignments and course exercises, not in practice, but rather in the initial instruction.
All strengths, no weaknesses. Loved it!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to other students if they are interested in improving their Arabic skills and studying abroad.

I would certainly recommend ARBC 130 with Professor Muhammed to another student. Professor Muhammed cared deeply about our individual and group interaction with the language. Additionally, the structure of the course is tailored to student improvement and challenging but fair. Finally, Professor Muhammed is an incredibly kind, thoughtful, and advanced teacher who expects and brings out the best in students.
